description:
Had my daughters Quinceneara on Feb 2/15. Billy was VERY patient with me and helped me with organizing the menu.  The kids had an amazing time and the bartender was so friendly. Everyone raved about the fries, wings and pizzas.
FYI call ahead to see if they are open on Sundays since they close some time.
Very fun place and it has a DJ booth if you want music
author: elizabeth t.

description:
Il Pirata is a great neighborhood bar and I like stopping in occasionally for Happy Hour and an early dinner.

I've had the appetizer platter, the grilled chicken cesar and the pizza now, which have all been quite decent for pub fare. The waitresses are nice and always come back to make sure you have a drink or everything you need. 

They have quite a number of beers on tap, always play the GIANTS when they are playing and can be a locals/regulars type of bar.

They have a large back room for those times where you want to throw a party and don't want to overthink the location. My friend had a party, brought in his own turn table equipment and threw quite the party with no cost for booking the room. It was awesome. 

They also have an outdoor patio with dart boards, a little place to get away and catch some sun on a sunny San Francisco day.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
So I came into here for an afternoon beer, and some grub before class. The bartender was extremely nice, and she was friendly. I was attended to pretty fast by a waitress for my lunch order.

I order a cheeseburger with bacon. It took over 20 minutes for them to make my food, and people got food before me that showed up later than me. The burger was pretty good, except they forgot mayo on it. 

I may come back here, give them another shot. But their service needs to improve, and ticket times need help as well...
author: Taylor G.

description: I love this place friendly staff & a great place to unwind after work or see some good night time entertainment or go dancing. The prices are average considering that this is San Francisco.
author: Forrest G.

description: Great Place to have a party!  We just had my husband's 50th birthday there and it was awesome. Nice bartenders and they have dj booth in the back you can use.  It was super fun and had enough space plus we didn't have to worry about drinks.  They also let us have a live band for part of the evening.
author: ruby r.

description: the chicken parm was nice and crispy! i loved it and would def come back. The steamed veggies were not memorable at all. It lacked flavor and I will def skip it next time. My meal was under $15 too.
author: Lisa N.

description:
I came here because my friends reserved the whole back room.

It was cool because they just let us play any music we wanted--just plug in a device and you can use the loud speaker system.

Beers were $5 each.
I am giving this place 1 star because the bartender was doing that thing where if you don't tip right away (or it seems like you're not going to tip at all) he will do some body language that makes you feel like he is going to punch you if you don't tip. I personally felt threatened and unwelcome by this person. The guy must be super poor to coerce people like that for measly dollar bills.

With that said, do not go to this dodgy joint.
author: Marlon T.

description:
So me and my friend were soo hungry and every where was closing for lunch. We were driving around SF for 30mins and we happened to come across Il Pirata. I remember the last time I was here was 15 years ago for drinks and it still looks the same. The lay out of the restaurant did not look like a place to eat in, just a bar with places to sit in. We ordered buffalo wings, crab salad and egg plant parmesan. Results? slow service and food was ummm decent?  Barely anyone in there and our waitress forgot the salad dressing. Check out my picture for the egg plant parmesan. What was up with the different kind of pasta on top? LOL 

Not worth the money to eat inside, but maybe to come for drinks!!
author: Kathy V.

description:
Good Food, friendly staff. Good portions and nice pours from the bar. I was working in the neighborhood and looking for a good spot for decent Italian food and stumbled in here. The Italian food I'd give 3 stars to, the pizza 4 stars and shockingly I ordered a cheeseburger here on french bread and I'd give that 5 stars. I'd also give the bar 5 stars as the bartenders were friendly and the pours weren't light and/or watered down.

Good jukebox, sports on the TVs. I can't complain.
author: Jason R.

description:
Big fan of Il Pirata or the "Pirate bar" as we like to call it.

I do have to pass along that the kitchen is closed for the next couple of weeks for remodeling- a sad fact since their app menu is delish.  

Still a fun bar for beers and giants cheers!
author: Martie A.

description: There are several reasons why Il Pirata deserves 5 stars. Personally I will always remember watching the Giants clinch their entry into the 2012 World Series by beating the Cardinals in game 7 of the NLCS. The vibe at Il Pirata was electric so I'll always remember being there for it. Il Pirata also hosts a fair amount of musical and comedy acts. Something this city desperately needs. It's a good spot for it as well. Finally I consider myself a french fry connoisseur and Il Pirata serves excellent steak fries, the kind that pairs well with any beer. Il Pirata is an old guard establishment that ought to be considered an historical landmark. But you get to go there for free, they don't even overcharge you for drinks.
author: Klik W.

description: This My Spot! The Comedy shows here are Every First & Third Friday!  With local & national headliners. It is the longest running underground comedy showcase to date. only surpassed by the Open Mic at the Brainwash hosted by Tony Sparks which happens to be the host of IL PIRATA's Comedy Showcase! The shows are always FREE and always the best!  #Dont SLeep! you'll have fun Trust Me!
author: KeyCo B.

description:
I love this place and the bartenders. First off - I tend to be an early guy, call me an early bird drinker. 

I Like: 1) Happy Hours  2) Being awake when I head out 3) early evening TV 4) Non-Club atmosphere most of the time.

This place has a clubby atmosphere later in the evening, but during the late afternoon, early evening it's a regulars kind of place. You see the same guys and gals when you go in here. There are 3 bartenders that I mostly recognize - the owner and his gf, and this guy John (I think) he reminds me of Danny at Molloys. Great bartenders making great drinks and this place is cheap. I order a manhattan from John and it comes in a bucket - a large rocks glass and it's made perfect every time. 

Check it out - they've got a few tv's (play the Giants games!) and play good upbeat music, usually hip hop type that's not so loud you can't talk to the guy next to you.
author: Rew C.

description:
Dope!!!!!!!!!!! Came here one night as a part of a comedy bar crawl and I was super impressed. It seems like a crackin place to chill on a Friday night. The music was on point, there was an outdoor patio and they had darts! 

Would love to see this place in action one day.
author: Ashley H.

description:
So we put our names down at Plow for brunch, told it was a 1.5 hour wait, and decided to go grocery shopping in the meantime.  On our way, we passed by this random looking place and there was a giant BRUNCH sign out front.  I was starving, and while I adore Plow, I was not excited about the wait.  I thought, why not?  Parking right in front.

We walked in at 11:41am and were the only ones there.  Hmmm.  Was seated at a booth where the menus were a little sticky and my bf got a dirty water glass.  Not the best of starts but hey, in for a penny, in for a pound.  Wow, are we glad we stayed.  The service was super friendly.  I asked if they would put an egg on my pizza, and the girl serving us had never heard of that, but asked sweetly how it was done, then went and told the kitchen.  I could see them looking out at me like I was crazy, and they laughed, but they were good sports and agreed to do it.  And they did it perfectly!  

The pizza was DELICIOUS!  The egg was perfect on top, just cooked enough but left the yolk nice and runny.  The girl watched me smear it all around and said she was going to try it that way next.  But egg or no egg, their pizza was unexpectedly good!  I actually think it can hold a candle to Pizzeria Delphina or Beretta, but at 1/2 the price!  And no wait!  Amazing!  I am amazed...and delighted...and full.  And did I mention the service was great?  Really nice people.

I will definitely come again for "brunch," especially when I'm not in the mood to wait.  Check it out for yourselves!
author: Jennifer F.

description:
This family-owned restaurant and bar has the neighborhood vibe with nice personality of bartenders and servers.  For sport enthusiast, it has the giants and niners ambience with several HD screens including the patio.  They also have darts at the patio.

Very spacious and great for events or private parties.

Not to mention their superb menu like the steak bruscetta for $9.95, 2 slices of homemade pizza for $3.50, it's a steal in SF.  Wine and beer has very reasonble price.

Some nights are salsa, comedy shows, DJ and chess games on Wednesdays 6-8 PM.

Check it out.
author: Jun L.

description:
What a wonderful little find this was! I went here this past weekend for a family dinner. Our waitress was wonderful the food is AMAZING. I went back yesterday to try the eggplant parm--DELISH. The Pasta alla capresse was delicious as well. Everyone at dinner really enjoyed the food--they ordered chicken dishes: chichen parm, lemon chicken, chicken marsala--everyone was raving about how amazing and fresh everything tasted. 

I'll probably be back again sometime this week.
author: Sarah D.

description:
I work down the block from this bar. Def our closest happy hour spot for now,. they have a back yard area with tables that can fit about 40 comfortably?! I only came here a few times for a company outing and anything that is company expense = a GOOD TIME! 

Shots are big and they free pour with no spout,. 

free pour = rock glass = FUN FUN FUN ! :)
author: Chanel L.

description:
I learned a lesson about myself here: I dance salsa like a gringa.  Translation: not very well.  Came here with my new guy on the recommendation of my roommate who used to go salsa dancing all the time.  I had loads of fun but I fear that my date's feet did not because I definitely stepped all over them. 

He, despite being a Jesse Eisenberg lookalike totally killed it-like a person transformed on the dance floor.  Spinning me like a top, and totally rocking the hips.  At first I laughed and then I gaped in awe, half-way dizzy from the spinning, halfway from my amazement at his ability.  Wow--total turn on watching a guy so comfortable on the dancefloor.

I, as I have mentioned, did not quite keep up, and I could tell that he was holding back a bit for my sake, slowing it down and leading more carefully.  The dance floor wasn't helping me out.  It is a bit on the smallish side, so I had to watch out when he spun me and when I backed up.  More than once I knocked into other dancers and got off rhythm.

I think I came here a while back for their trance night, which works better with this kind of space, but I definitely liked it and would love to do it again.  Though I am definitely going to have to practice some moves if I'm going to keep up with this guy.
author: Nikki K.

description: Great little joint.  Good menu, good pizza (I recommend asking for the hawaiin but get bbq sauce... they looked at us funny, but it is amazing and we love it!... they should have it on their menu)  They have lots of tv's and very pleasant staff.  Loved the two outdoor eating areas and sitting at the bar. Loved the pitcher of mimosas for $13.00... and it was fantastic! :)  We will return.
author: Lyndsey C.

description: I went here for the free comedy show, I think they host it annually, the first Friday of the month. The show was pretty good, the space is really dive-y, so yeah it's cool to check out if you're into the comedy show scenes!
author: Josie C.

description:
Mike M threw his birthday party here and it was a great spot to do so. Plenty of room for dancing (we bought our own DJs), the bar and restrooms are in the front so there's no traffic cutting through while you're trying to dance the night away. Plenty of booths to sit in a relax and two patios for a breather. 

It's got a divey, laid-back kind of vibe...Plus the regulars here are kind of a trip, one guy propositioned a friend: "whiskey and coke, huh? I've got some of that in my car."

Granted we almost got mugged on our walk home, so be sure and be safe when finished enjoying the delightful grittiness of this bar.
author: Nikki M.

description:
Have I been to worse places? Yes.
Have I been to better places? Yes.
author: Mariel F.

description:
I'm finding that the kitchen can be somewhat hit-or-miss with the quality of the burgers. Sometimes they're juicy, flavorful, and a perfect layout of accouterments. Other times they're overcooked and the fries are too starchy.  Right now they're batting a little over .500.

For the sports fans, Il Pirata is a fantastic spot for catching the local game. Enthusiastic crowds show up here regularly, giving off that vibe you just can't get in your living room.
author: Christopher K.

description: Il Pirata has become 100x better since my last review. Service is on target and the food has improved 10 fold. Its nice being a regular here.
author: Rio A.

description: I absolutely love this divey little joint. It's great for a group lunch with my coworkers. Sit out on the patio on a sunny day, have a beer, eat some greasy food. Happy as a clam.
author: Mark S.

description:
They claim to have great pizzas but I believe they should be best known for their burgers!!! 

It's probably one of the best burger I have ever eaten from a dive bar. Their garlic fries are awesome and it is the way it is suppose to be made. Fresh chunks of garlic where your mouth burns from strong garlic and not from the temperature. Their salads are surprisingly good and fresh as well. For a dive bar, I was impressed on how fresh the ingredients were. 

Service could have been better but what do you expect from a dive bar right? 

The decor of the place is divvy but I have been to a lot worst place. For me, personally, it didn't really bother me. Couple of booth seatings and some 4 seaters in the middle of the restaurant/bar. It is a little dark in there. Not really a date place unless you have been dating for a while and no longer need to impress anyone. 

Great food. Probably good for an before/after game meal/drinks.
author: jason g.

description:
Spent the better part of the day at Il Pirata for a reunion Sunday. What a great time we all had.  Great Food, great drinks, service with a smile, funky but perfect  patio for the party. We BBQd,ate pizza drank and flapped our gums all afternoon. Some even went into the bar and enjoyed the great crowd for the 49r game. 
For a dive bar this is a great place.  Thanks to the staff for letting us go over our party time. Will definately go back and will be booking more parties there for sure.
author: Ann L.

description:
I so wanted to give this place a chance, but they failed miserably!  I even bought a gift certificate to this place just so I can give them the benefit of the doubt.  

I came in after work w/ the hubby & started off w/ a beer & calamari.  They brew their own beer, which wasn't too bad.  But the calamari...where do I begin?...The meat was too chewy.  It needed to cook longer, it wasn't even crispy.  It was served w/ lemon & a side of tartar sauce!  I get so disappointed eating at a restaurant when they serve your daily refrigerated sauce.  I feel like being at home instead.  

For my entree, I had the pasta alla pirata which was pasta in red sauce with sausage & mushrooms.  I happen to like this one.  My hubby on the other hand hated his tuna melt, but liked the side salad.

This place was just full of bar flies.  Only consider coming here for drinks.
author: Jo B.

description:
I brought a group here tonight after an event we had in the 'hood because I identified it as one of the few places that was actually open past 5pm on a Sunday (gotta love SF sometimes). 

To level-set: one of the categories explicitly listed here for Il Pirata is "dive bar"... I see some people dinged Il Pirata for the food but let's be clear: dive bar ratings are *inversely* correlated to quality and comfort.  Besides beer & peanuts, a dive bar should never get dinged if items other than these are NOT good.

I didn't even order anything (see above paragraph), but was immediately entranced by the raucous rock 'n roll and pungent contact high aroma that would let anyone's guard down (even mine, if I had one). The decisive moment, however, came when some patrons entered into a pretty fierce altercation. This went on for about 5 minutes, until The Management finally stepped in with a special siren apparently designed for just these kinds of cases. 

It was a beautiful unfolding of events. 

I'll definitely be coming back.
author: Diane B.

description:
Ordered a medium greek pizza here the other day and asked for olives on only half of the pizza, but ended up picking out olives over lunch. The pizza was good, picking out olives wasn't that much of a drag, but definitely preferred to not having to do so. 

The outdoor back patio was nice, especially on a oddly hot early February day. There's a TV screen back there for watching sports and whatnot. 

I might come back again for drinks or to try their other food items on the menu.
author: Kim L.

description:
Good service? No. Good food? No. TWO stars for a serious "Meh. I've experienced better."

A girlfriend & I stumbled upon this spot as a last resort. We just came back from a deeeeeep tissue massage, felt a bit famished, and were in need of nourishment. We didn't have very much luck w/ a few other venues, so we decided to give this place a try.

It's located in the Potrero area, plenty of street parking available. They have a little lot, but it only holds about 3 cars comfortably.

Dining took place in the bar area. It was very dark, especially for a meal at 2PM. (It looked like a sketchy place, a place a married man would take their "mistress".)

The food was mediocre. We ordered wings, crab salad, and an eggplant Parmesan plate. Again, the food didn't impress much but I was hungry so we killed the wings and extra celery sticks pretty quick. The salad came out next. The crab looked fresh and meaty. Although I was pretty excited to try it out, I couldn't. It was missing the dressing. So, I waited... and I waited... and I waited. It took our waitress about 15 minutes to bring the dressing out. I just stared at it. 

Bottom line: 
*If you are hungry and looking for a good spot w/ good service, this is probably not the place for you. Hopefully their bar service & drink specials are better.
author: Joy A.

description:
My favorite thing about il pirata is how they double book events and can't give any warning beforehand.  It wasn't my event, but I did give up going to a show because I was supposed to go here instead.  

The best part is that I told friends from out of town to meet me here and now I feel really stupid.  

Anyway, I don't think this place is that amazing but I was willing to give it another tonight since they actually had something booked that seemed really cool. 

I probably will never come here again, which is pretty sad since I only live 4 blocks away.
author: A K.

description:
I had my 30th bday here last may,from what little i remember it was amazing. They were very awesome letting me rent the space for nothing ,we packed the place no doubt so it was a good fit for both parties.Thank you.

The brunch menu is good ,not amazing for choices but what they do have is pretty good.

They always have sports on which for me is a thumbs up all the way.

Warm family ownership,great wait staff.

Now for my negative. Expensive.And not much in terms of drink specials .They have some beer specials, but to be honest I'm not much of a beer drinker. I'd like to see some development in this area for happy hour and such.
author: Lauren V.

description:
Bought a Restaurant.com certificate to here because it's literally about 2 blocks from our apartment so I figure why not give it a try.  Pleasantly surprised.  

Went the Sunday after Christmas, it was pretty dead inside - EXCEPT for a decent number of 49ers fans.  Had NO idea this place was a sports bar, guess it's not really, not sure what you'd classify it as actually, but it does have a good number of huge TVs for watching the game, and then also separate rooms w/ no TVs if that's not your thing. 

As for the food, not the best I've ever had, some items better than others, but overall good experience.  Since we had the rest.com gift certificate we had to spend a minimum of $35 on food (pre-tax/tip).  At most SF places that's not difficult to do; here however, we ended up w/ 3 starters (steak bruschetta, classic salad, & wings) and two of the more expensive-ish entrees (chicken scallopini and chicken parm).   The bruschetta was a little oily for my taste but good.  Salad was really good, fresh, and a large portion.  The wings we just got to go b/c had so much food coming already (ate them the next day for lunch, pretty good, could have been hotter).  Both chicken dishes were good, nothing spectacular but met expectations (i.e. we weren't in North Beach and we knew that when we ordered, got what we expected). 

Best part of the meal were definitely the waitress (who I think was also the manager/owner?) and bartender.  Both seemed like great gals, knew the patrons coming in to watch the game by name, a good mood and smiling face can go a long way - particularly when eating a hungover lunch.  

I think next time I'll come back for brunch, cheap menu with what looked like good cure for what ails you - pitchers of mimosas on an outdoor patio & pancakes would sure make me happy fast.
author: Mandi C.

description: Free comedy night is bananas! The comics are funny, the bartenders are hella cool and the people are awesome! My new favorite!
author: Sarah M.

description:
I would give zero stars if I can.

I walked in to the restaurant, stood there for about five minutes waiting for someone to acknowledge my friend and I.  No one talked to us at all. We finally went to Togo's.
author: Joanna W.

description:
BEST BAR FOOD EVER!!!  Why these guys don't have an entire wall full of Best of the Bay awards is beyond me.  The Seafood Bruschetta...best I've ever had.  The Steak Bruschetta is equally amazing!  A slice of "Il Pirata" pizza is perfect for when you're in that mood.  Overall, their food is such a change from the usual deep fried, greasy food that most bars serve.  

BUT WAIT, IT GETS BETTER!  They have flat screen TVs all through the bar section of the place so you can come watch ALL your favorite sports events at the same time!  

There is a FULL BAR, not just beer & wine.

There is a DJ setup and Il Pirata does music of all kinds, from electronica to Salsa (Fridays) in the evenings, which adds another element to the experience.

THEY HAVE TWO OUTDOOR SEATING AREAS!  One is a smoking area with heated lamps and 2 dart boards.  The other, a large open patio with trees around it.

The whole space is warm and inviting.  It feels "homey" and comfortable.  The staff is great...friendly and they don't make you wait to get served.

Il Pirata is one of my favorites in SF!!!
author: Rocky D.

description: It has nothing to with pirates, but Il Pirata IS a family owned and operated bar/restaurant with yummy, affordable food and an old school atmosphere. When my boyfriend and I were there for lunch yesterday, we chose to sit at one of the booths in the bar instead of the restaurant because it felt cozier. There were a few people sitting at the bar wearing Santa hats, and a good number of the patrons seemed to know each other. There was a very Neighborhood Bar feel to the place, but one which didn't make us feel unwelcome. Even better, both Anchor Steam and Guinness cost a mere $5/pint. (AND the bartender actually knew how to properly pour a Guinness, which makes a world of difference.)
author: Katrina J.

description:
I've decided to edit my review for this place. As I was driving by the other day, I realized that a place as festive as this should get a more interesting review. 
So come here during the weeknights and you will be met with trance on Thursdays. Something used to happen on Wednesdays, but that was last year, so I am not sure if I should review about it if it doesn't happen anymore. 
But really, the best time to come here is on a Saturday around 10am. Yes, am as in the morning. Bring a friend and order a pizza. Then drink I away your Saturday.
author: joanna r.

description:
The pizza is simply not that good. This reminds me of pizza from Little Caesars, but oilier. Now if the point of coming here is for ironic reasons like drinking a PBR or wearing a mustache with curly ends, then okay fine. The space is a lot of fun looking but you will have to ignore the "dank". They have patios which other reviewers have said make this place. I may possibly come back to try this but only with a beer. Also, don't miss out on checking out the murals in this place, they are not to be missed (quite serious).

I can probably summarize it this way: If you are coming to this place as a dive bar and you would like the convenience of having food in the next room, this is the place. I would suggest being drunk before you eat it though. Watch a game here or come for some late night dive bar action.
author: Eric G.

description: The food is very good.. I allways have the fetticinni cabernera, its eneough for 2 people, there bread & butter is warm and toasty....... spinich salad is a meal all by itself...
author: Deborah R.

description:
The Staff here are absolutely amazing. Super helpful and accomodating. As well as professional and and just all-around fun!

I "rented" out the venue to put on a fundraiser for my organizations (they actually don't rent their space, they let you use their venue for free!!! AND there's no bar minimum!). 

The event required use of technical equipment (AV stuff). Billy (the co-owner, i believe) was more than helpful in terms of answering our questions. 

The wait staff was amazing. We got everything  that we asked for, and the the waitress was very personable. 

The food is wonderful and reasonably priced, and they make stiff drinks which I love!

This place gets a triple thumbs up!
author: Diane N.

description: Great beer, Great Service, pet Friendly patio, 1/2 block from home...
author: Lidia Z.

description:
So, I was in Bed Bath and Beyond (shit...did I just admit that?) I mean, I was hanging out with some ho's in Soma (that sounded better), and wanted some food on my way back to my place. On my way to Mighty, I've seen the awesome retro neon lights of this place catch my eye night after wasted night, and swore I would one day get my ass in there. Well I did.

It was a Monday night, so it was not this huge party that a lot of people have seen. However, it was full of all kinds of professional drinkers...ah yes. My peeps. What I did *not* know about this place before I went in is that it is a *sports bar* on *sports nights*! Now, I'm not a big sports fan, and therefore generally, sports bars are not my kind of thing. This was an amazingly awesome reversal:

The small crowd that was there was all a lot of fun to talk to and make friends with at the bar. Even as people got drunker and drunker, no one got all screaming team names/stupid team chants...thank god. I hate that frat boy shit. So, a chill, drunk crowd, all watching a game. Very cool. Oh yeah, the bartender had a old skool fire siren that he turned on when the Giants won at the end of the game...that is just plain funny :).

The burger I had was actually really really good. I thought I was just going to get something to fill the void, but it turned out that I got a fantastic burger for like $10. Nice! 

I'll be coming back on another weeknight to try and catch the same sort of vibe.
author: Sean C.

description:
My old co-worker is pretty awesome, so when she invited me for a daytime birthday shindig, I was RSVP'd and ready to roll. 

I barted into 16th street Mission and walked 15 minutes east through what many would consider a suspicious area, but there were others walking so I didn't feel completely unsafe. I'm glad I wore sneaks and kept my heels in my bag.

Il Pirata is the kind of divey I know and LOVE. This was a great place for an eclectic crowd of friends from many walks of life. She had the outdoor patio to herself (one main area, there is a second area) and brought her own tacos. You drift into the main bar area (and entrance) where you sit and notice that the bartenders look out for female patrons. I have a place in my heart for guys that look out for you in the face of questionable predators.

Their Il Pirata Pale Ale = bueno. The location is out of the way for me, but I'll be back if there's a reason to roll out.
author: Jojo L.

description:
Joanna R. just held her 21st birthday here (she doesn't look a day over 17, I swear!!!) and it was super fun times.  Yes, the women's bathroom involves an odd series of doors that lead to an unreasonably small space, but just keep this in mind before slamming some drunken mother (literally) in the face upon your exit/entrance.  Pizza is actually delish and, like, totally cheap!  There was a decent sized group of us that ordered, like, 7 pizzas and it only put us back $10 a person. GET OUT, you say? GO TO FUCKING HELL, I say back, as I am not a filthy liar!  Merely filthy.

The jukebox borders the pretty crappy/crappy county line, but it does have "Jigsaw Puzzle" by ye olde Rolling Stones, which happens to be in my top 5 of stones' songs, thank you very much.  

But let's finally get real for a sec: it's obviously the drunken mothers that make the place, those drunken pirate mothers.  Joanna plans on becoming one when she's 27. BINGO BOINGO!
author: Chloe S.

description: They serve great food (pizza, burgers, everything and strong drinks. The patio is nice and the sex back there is killer!
author: Tom H.

description:
Weird place. 

One of those venues I've been to like 100 times but never remember because it was always something different. I've been here on salsa nights, psyc-trance nights, drum n' bass nights. The only distinguishing characteristics are its string of Christmas lights and crusty regulars. 

Then again, maybe it's just a chameleon. As someone who's not seen her real hair color since the Clinton Administration, I can relate to that.
author: Suzanne R.

description:
flat beer. old reheated pizza. off-brand rotgut in premium bottles. what's not to love? 

I am done with this place.
author: S M.

description:
I'm absolutely biased to this place, but rightfully so... I spend practically every Wednesday evening at this bar having fun.  Wednesdays, Il Pirata and the Synchronize Patrons serve up usually excellent psy-trance beats, and so the San Francisco Psy-Trance kids come out to play and have fun.  The bartenders are always kind, and serve up plenty of free drinks (thanks Billy and Bill) and whether you're in the dance room, or at the bar, there's plenty of fun to be had and people to meet.  The owner, the bartenders, the staff are always there and come off very friendly and are always willing to help out and get to know you. 

I've also been there on Tuesdays and had the priveledge of tasting some of their food, and though the service was a bit slow (too many folks and not enough wait staff) it sure was yummy.  

Saturdays, Fridays, and Sundays the bar also serves up your variety of styles from 80s to Industrial to Salsa (one of their biggest draws!).  There's an outdoor patio and plenty of room inside.... though it can get pretty humid and the bathroom situation leaves a few things to be desired.  The huge TV screen is great for the sport fanatics, and the cheap drinks (and strong!) are good for your pocket (though not necessarily the head on the following morning).

Anyway, I love this place for all my shenannigans!
author: Vicky B.

description:
Okay... An Italian pirate bar?  On the dirty side of Potrero Hill? I was a little confused as to what to expect here, but here's the real low-down. 

-- No pirates
-- Decent Italian eats
-- GREAT patio, in an area of the city with few patios (and little worth looking at; but this one is luckily shielded from the bleak streetscape)
-- LOTS of drunk sports fans

The drunk sports fans kinda threw me for a loop, but I'm always down for drunk sports fans, especially when their team sucks (you're a WEALTH of entertainment there, SF!). 

There's no happy hour specials, though. Even though the bartender will tell you that "certain beers are just always less expensive here." 

Well, um, I kinda expect that to be the case. Like, you're not REALLY going to charge the same for Bud as you do for Fat Tire, are you? 

Really?

Come aaahhhnnn...

THAT DOES NOT CONSTITUTE A "SPECIAL."

Other than that, this is a nice little neighborhood spot that I guess I won't keep to myself, because I just yelped it.

Eh -- the patio is big enough...
author: Lisa T.

description:
I love this place...It is around the corner from my house and its an easy breezy bar....no scene here..just mellow, cool, good old fashioned fun dive/sports bar.
The heated patio is a bonus and Bill sr, Bill jr, Bill, & Billy all make great drinks....and are all very sweet.  Mvah.

Trivia* ***
Bill Sr was the original owner of Bottom Of the Hill before he took on Il Pirata...;)
author: Michele K.

description:
This place is like the Chuck E. Cheese of dive bars. There's booze for the drinkers. Food for the fatties (or ok, just hungry). A patio for the smokers. A dancefloor for the two-steppers. Dart boards for the dartists. A big screen TV for the sports fans. A ton of seating for the lazy and over-worked. And the refreshing part that makes it different? Because the space is so big, you can pick which group you fall in and pretty much avoid the other groups for most of the night. 

The staff here is always friendly and tons of fun. Come watch them play darts on their home game nights and you'll never believe people could shit talk so much and have such a good time (especially since they're playing darts - I know, darts!). 

Disclaimer:

Even with it's variety of patrons, Il Pirata is truly a neighborhood bar at its core, so before you start planning your BART ride and bus route up from San Leandro, you should expect Cheers, not Coyote Ugly. 

It's also the kind of place where you should check the schedule before you walk in, because the crowd changes drastically depending on the night's events. We're talking psych-trance raver-hippies one night, die-hard Giants fans another. Again, you can limit your interaction with these sorts by simply going into another room for the most part, but don't blame me if a braless hippie girl all painted and lit up like a psychedelic space alien with dread-locked pigtails asks you for a smoke outside. 

Food wise, avoid the garlic bread. The garlic part is not so much baked as it is chopped and placed raw on top of toasted, buttered bread, and it just isn't what you'd normally expect garlic bread to taste like. I would also skip the minestrone soup if it's on the menu when you go in. It's all pepper, no salt in my experience.  

Otherwise, come as you are, order the pizza and if you have a sense of humor, a Bud Light Lime (ha!) or a car bomb and enjoy the space.
author: Kat E.

description:
So this is one of those places that you love to hate on, but you know the moment you'll step in that you'll be back again and again.  My office right down the street goes here pretty much every Friday for their big and cheap pitchers, and every week I leave feeling a little happier than I arrived.  And a little more buzzed :)  I'm not sure I would deliberately make a trip out to this bar when I wasn't already at work, but it's got a solid atmosphere, lots of space, and just feels like home - right down to the crust on the counters.  When the weather's nice out, you can't beat the TWO patios - one has a kind of garden-y feel with ivy on the walls and the other one is kind of a pass-through because it faces the street.

Oh, and I recently discovered that every Wednesday they have AWESOME dj trance music.  A local crew comes in and throws down the beats - it's a pretty hardcore crowd of Burners, ravers, and hippies.  Yum.  Who knew that a dive bar would have that kind of regular event??  

One thing that has always wierded me out about it is the ladies' bathroom.  There's this like vestibule where you can look at yourself in the head-to-toe mirror, and try to regain your balance and make the world stop spinning, and then there's this vestibule where you can wash the sweaty scum off your hands, and then finally there's the toilet.  The ONE toilet, surrounded by green faux marble tiles.  I am never quite sure whether to vomit, cry, or laugh when I open the door into the bathroom.  

AND!  They let us Rick-roll our coworkers' going away party with their AV system!!! How's THAT for service?
author: Becky N.

description: Ok club/bar.  I had fun there.  Parking was ok.  I went to a drum n bass party there like 12 years ago.  It wasn' that special of a spot for me really.  No magic or deep desire to go back.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
I came here for lunch with some work friends, as our office is not too far from here. The food was okay -- the pizza crust was too thin for my taste, though. 

However, the kitchen has the inability to make all the food come out at the same time. We ordered 3 pizzas and a chicken scallopini. Two of the pizzas came out at about the same time. We were done eating those when the third one showed up. We were nearly done eating the third when the chicken showed up and my friend had to wolf hers down because the rest of us were pretty much done eating. She complained, and they knocked $3 off her meal. I think they should have given it to her for free.

Not sure we'll be back, despite its closeness.
author: Kellie P.

description: Place is a total dive but has a bitchin' burger.
author: John W.

description:
I've never eaten here, but it's a dive bar, for sure.  The bartenders and owners are friendly and it's true, they do try to get you wasted.  For the Jaeger fans, they serve it ice cold on tap.

Music comes from the jukebox, but don't expect exceptional sound quality.  The bathroom is as small as my closet and always seems to get backed up.  Ladies beware:  The boys can hear you in the men's restroom when you're using the toilet.

This isn't a place I would frequent, but if you want drinks and don't care about ambiance or location, you can grab your drinks here.
author: Annalynn C.

description:
I love Il Pirata. Its a bar/ restaurant. The drinks and food are tasty. Its basic-big-portioned-Italian food, pizza and pasta. They can make it vegetarian if you ask.

Whats really great is the first Friday of every month they have a well done comedy show. It's some of the best local comedians and it's FREE!

The place isn't fancy and its pretty dark, but it's a great bar and the comedy show provides a lot of free laughs.
author: M. J.

description:
I had always been put off by Il Pirata's dingy-looking outside, but a friend suggested we go there for lunch and it was pretty good. I got a Cobb salad - good portion size, reasonably priced. Not gourmet, but it doesn't pretend to be. 

I have a short lunch break, and we told the waitress ahead of time that we were on a strict schedule. She brought us the check exactly on time without having to be reminded.
author: Olivia V.

description:
This place smelled like stale beer and stale piss.  I didn't know that I could stand downwind a bathroom in a dive bar.

I did party here with a bunch of guys dressed up in animal suits last year.   That was one crazy night.....
author: Jay H.

description:
So we went here this past Sunday for my friend's birthday celebration.  They told me that Sundays are busy at Il Pirata with the grill that would be raging with tons of food and the DJ would be spinning reggae all day and night and rastafarians (both real and wannabe) would be aplenty.  OK, so the DJ showed up but no food and no people.  Granted it was Easter Sunday and we did show up at 4pm which in my terms is kind of early.  However, by the time 8pm rolled around there were a few more people and the DJ was spinning a nice (although not very good with the transitions) set of both dancehall, roots, and dub reggae and marijuana smoking was done freely and frequently (as one would expect with a reggae club) so that was a plus.

The interior of Il Pirata is actually pretty big.  Once you walk in the front door there's a decent sized bar area and then the next room which is the main dance room, was pretty big and roomy.  But the plus is the two big outdoor areas, one in the back with lots of tables and the grills however too many trees blocking the sun...the second outdoor area was to the side facing the street.  So I definitely was digging the size of the place.  Now the real plus is the $2 Red Stripes.  Hard to beat that deal.  

The only real knock on Il Pirata is it's location.  Not really anywhere near anything else as is most places in Potrero and far from my house but nonetheless I would recommend going here.  Now please remember that I came here one time and on a Sunday.  I couldn't tell you how the other nights are.
author: David C.

description: I came had 3 vodka tonics with cheap vodka, and a diet rum and coke also with cheap alcohol, results....WASTED! Cheap date I was. That's what happens when you drink cheap strong alcohol on a empty stomach. Bartender was attentive and huge TVs to watch the Giants game!
author: Karen T.

description:
I've been working at work at 16th and Florida for the past few weeks and decided to venture a bit further east for lunch. I've had drinks at Il Parata before but never eaten there so I thought I'd give it a try. I sat at one of the worn booths and ordered a grilled chicken sandwich on a french roll. The waitress told me that they only had wheat bread (WTF?). Since I was hungry I agreed to the wheat. I was promptly brought my drink but I had to wait 40 minutes for my sandwich to arrive. It was pretty skimpy with the lettuce, onion, and tomato composing the majority of the sandwich.

Il Pirata is a good place for drinks but forget about eating there.
author: Bumble B.

description:
I find the food here hit or miss, never too excited by it. The huge patio and overly friendly waitress makes up for it though. Also, the kinda freaky waitress is a hoot too, I've seen her at the Zeitgeist sometimes so I figure she's alright.
At night the bartenders are super friendly and the patrons are mostly nice older dudes who like them some sports on the tv.
author: Colleen B.

description:
I got two meals takeaway here this afternoon, so I can't really comment much on service, ambience, etc.

The person who took down my order and handed me my food was friendly enough.  The portions were HUMUNGOUS -- each $9 meal could easily feed 2-3 hungry people.

The food seemed to be of decent quality... nice cuts of meat, not fatty or bony.

So if you're looking for a good value and reasonably tasty food -- I'd give this place 4 or 4.5 stars.

BUT... if you're looking for something that tastes more than a couple of notches above cafeteria food, you may want to look elsewhere.  The chicken marsala and stuffed pork were both sadly uninspired, to say the least.  Tender, yes, even a bit juicy... but just otherwise nothing to write home about.

One more positive item, though, in this pathetically disjointed review:  The veggies were cooked decently... not mushy, not like a rock.  So for once -- and maybe this is a good thing -- I was far more inspired to eat all my veggies INSTEAD of the meat.  My veghead friends would approve :)
author: Adam L.

description:
Came here one Friday evening -- not for salsa night, but for Triple Power, a monthly electronic dance party. I've been to Triple Power before, but this was my first time at Il Pirata.

Triple Power usually has a bunch of great DJs playing and the people who show up to these parties are usually pretty cool. It was funny sitting by the door, because you could definitely distinguish the Il Pirata regulars huddling by the bar from the rest of the people there for Triple Power. It was all good -- everyone was fun and friendly.

Our bartender hooked us up with some good strong drinks. I'm tired of going out and emptying my wallet for watered-down cocktails, so just for that one drink, I love this place!

The place has a main bar, a dancefloor and two patios -- lots of places to explore.

http://www.triplepower.org
author: Joel A.

description:
There are a few things in life that I love.  Sunshine, reggae, and drinking beer in the sunshine while listening to reggae.  Il Pirata provides me with all of these things that I love every Sunday afternoon.  The event is called "Church".

Often times, I'll pretend that I have too much to do.  I'll pretend that I have to go grocery shopping at Safeway or pretend that I'm going to gym.  I just happen to wander down Utah and hear the reggae and peek my head in and pretend that I'm just going to have one beer.  Hours pass and many beers are consumed ($10 buckets of red stripe!).  The food is also incredible.  I always get the Jamaican style fish with rice and beans.   

I have to admit, every other time I stop into Il Pirata, I'm slightly disappointed.  I think it is because it doesn't get much better than Church.
author: Zoe H.

description:
Overall: 3
I'd go back due to the lack douchebags and crowds.

Service: 4
Bartender was quick and the pours were big.

Decor: 3
Nice bar, big dance floor and outdoor patio for smoking but it was kinda dingy.

Ambiance: 2
Hurting  DJ. Everyone is on the dance floor... standing around. Waiting to dance, wanting to dance yet the DJ couldn't deliver so people walked off So bad that it hurt me. The proof is in the pudding.  It was so bad people were ready to drink the Kool-Aid.

Value: 3
Some of the prices were good, some of them were high so it just averages out to regular.
author: Roger H.

description:
We spent NYE here, so my memory of the place is a little hazy.  I do remember we definitely had a good time.  I suppose the fact that friends set up the party, and that hence the place was full of our friends, contributed to that.  But the place seems like a good spot--roomy, including space for a dancefloor in the 2nd room, and an outdoor patio behind that.  Only downer was waiting 3-4 deep at the bar for drinks.  But I imagine that that doesn't happen on most nights that aren't the last one of the year.  

So to sum up, I could see returning here in this new year.  It's conveniently located, within walking distance of the Mission.  Or take the 22-Fillmore or the 33-Stanyan--just consult nextmuni.com (or call 511) for those arrival times!
author: Suman G.

description:
This is for all you Argentine tango fiends:

Il Pirata has a milonga ( http://www.tejastango.com/terminology.html#M --Yelp, you need to allow html in your editor!) every Saturday night in the rather tiny back room of the divey bar.  It's a weird pairing of vibes, separated only by a lone red (?) curtain half-heartedly pulled across the divide.

The beer drinkers on the other side will usually peek around the barrier at some point, or even venture in to try sneaking into the line of dance... but usually mixing is minimal.  It's feels like one of those "business class/first class - don't step foot into the cabin you ain't paid for" kind of deals, and the strange thing is that as you go from one to the next (you do have to use the bathroom once in a while, and that's on the divey side) everything changes around you: you go from warm to cool, tango music to t.v. drone, fishnets to jeans.

The dance crowd here is clique-y; most of them are seasoned dancers and unless you're a beginner like me with a few friends in the "inner circle," you won't get much time on the dance floor.  This is a sad thing if you're super psyched about tango but lack the years under your belt, but you have to deal with it in tango circles everywhere.

If you do go, brush up during the week at practicas and other more casual milongas, and then dress up when you make your appearance on Saturday--this isn't like Wednesday nights at Cell Space.  Wear your little black dress, your dress slacks, the feather in your hat.  You'll fit right in.
author: Coleen B.

description: This dive is another one of the Potero highlights. Its never very busy and the drinks are cheap and the food is decent. Nothing here will blow you away but if you are looking for a bar with booths, pizza, cheese sticks, beer and a full bar then this is it.
author: Joseph M.

description:
Okay-  

I don't know about the food--which seems to be the "on the fence" item for Il Pirata.  

All I can comment on is the wonderful Reggae parties on Sundays.  As a matter of fact, I'm going over there later.  
-great vibe

-2 DOLLAR RED STRIPES.  (and when I say 2,  I mean seriously, 2.  In the city of San Francisco, CA.  I have never heard of such a thing)

-patios WITH heaters so on those sunny but cold SFdays, you can feel like you're in Jamaica, for a while. 

-you can do what you wanna
author: Nathalie P.

description: I dj'ed a kid's party here last night, loved the place.  I was here about a month ago meeting the cl ient, was also impressed then.  It is a family owned restaurant and bar, Billy and Diana brother and sister bartend, father Bill owns the restaurant.  It is definitely a "Cheers" type place.  Mike the manager last night for the party was great, a special kind of person.  The food is good, the atmosphere is great.  I stayed last night for a while after the kid's party, for "old school" night, with another (very good) dj, had one of the best times in quite a while.
author: Jason R.

description:
I like this place because:

- they have a cool little secluded backyard patio
- they have a reggae party on sunday
- they have big tv's for watching football
- they make french bread pizza just like mom used to
author: Allison R.

description:
Yay for comedy nights at Il Pirata!

This divey kinda bar is alright in my book. The front bar area was packed and in the back room, they had chairs set up for the acts. Needlessly to say I downed many a beer here and the bartenders were quick to keep up with me. Great service and fairly good prices. $5 hefs and $6 blue moons. 

Post comedy routine was spent out on the outside deck with a few seats to enjoy your beer out of the rain. The crowd's pretty diverse albeit a little older--not quite the place for the average twenty something. Totally lax atmosphere and the place has got some personality. I'll definitely be back.
author: katie k.

description: Kind of a dump. The dining room was empty and kind of a hole in the wall. The food was only so -so but since we were the only ones in the dining room, our waitress gave us excellent service which is why I'm giving it 2 stars instead of 1.
author: Clive L.

description:
I can't really say anything about the place as a neighborhoood hangout--and I don't think I would go there just to hang out, but there's a room in the back you can rent for private parties. There's seating, a sound system, room for dancing, and easy access to the bar.  Kind of divey & rough around the edges-but colorful, which was perfect for the event. 

As far as the regular bar crowd, it seemed pretty neighborhoody and mellow for a weekend.
author: N B.

description: I am here with my co-workers after work and it is a wonderful place to hang out with some of the best drinks in town! The service is very good as well. I adore their dirty martini's and hot wings. The outdoor patio is fabulous.
author: Ilena A.

description:
Cute space for friendly parties.... huge space for a nice afternoon drink and food.  Didn't eat there, but it looked like a lovely place for dive bar.. and if you are expecting much in Portrero Hill, you are either disillusioned, pompous, or silly.

Nice little dive bar.  Lots of outside space.  They seem to dig on sports, which is the reason it is less a nice 5 star review.... cause you end up with football people there.  Too bad for me.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description:
I came here for a friends birthday party. It was during the day so we weer able to enjoy the patio (one of two by the way, extra star for that).

The bar was divided into two areas which was nice. I liked that. It means if there's a band or DJ, you can still sit at the bar and actually have a conversation. Then, if you hear your favorite song, get up and be "all up in it" within a few steps.

Two outdoor patios, super score. Both very pleasant equipped with heat lamps and terraces. I didn't spend much time here but I will certainly hit it up on another nice and sunny afternoon for some cocktails or happy hours.
author: alexa c.

description: Just passed by this place because I needed to pick something up at UPS. Best burger I've had in SF; not even close! I'll be taking the bus from Inner Richmond back here (yes, worth the haul) again soon. Strong drinks (but I started with a beer, which tasted flat to me, so I switched). Nice, real people, patrons... the place was full of obvious regulars. So refreshing to find a place with no hipsters and no one that thinks spending $100+ on a pair of jeans is perfectly normal. SF would be a more pleasant place with more working class bars like this. I wish it was closer to home!
author: jim b.

description:
stopped in for a bite about a week ago and you can tell this place has been around for a long time. Sat in a booth with my girlfriend, and we ordered a greek salad, bruschetta, spaghetti and meat balls, and a couple beers. The server was polite and brought our food when it was ready, but basically left us alone, which I really like. This is no 4 star place, so don't expect to be waited on excessively. The food was really good. Nothing fancy, but it was very well put together. The Bruschetta has huge chunks of tomato, basil and mozzarella, and you scoop it on yourself. The spaghetti came with a healthy 3 very large meatballs, cut in half - more than enough for a good balance with the pasta. The Greek salad was also simple but very tasty, with very flavorful olives, and a good mix of the right kind of veggies. We didn't venture into the bar area except to peek around, but it seemed like a local dive, with an assortment of intersting people, who were friendly and jovial. The food was very reasonably priced-$ 5.95 bruschetta, $8 spaghetti I think. I'll be back for sure. Thanks for a great meal Il Pirata!!

Ordered some takeout again tonight. still 5 stars. great meal - and on a nice sunny day, there is a killer back patio. So rare these days. Nice.
author: teague k.

description:
I love Il PIrata.  Friends of mine are serious regulars, and I always have an awesome time when I join them there for some shenannigans.  

It is a really cool mix of people, and there are two different patios with a huge indoor space.  

The drinks are no joke, the jukebox is no joke and there is always sports on the big screen tvs.  There is something for everyone, including cute boys.
author: Sheila B.

description:
While it sounds like the Il Pirata is a good place for drinks later in the evening, it is nothing less than horrible as a restaurant. A friend put it best, "Il Pirata has been prancing around far too long as a restaurant that is really just an alcoholics' bar."

I rolled in around 7:30, absolutely starving and looking for a bite to eat. The place was filled to less than 1/3 of its total capacity. "Good, it won't take too long to get a bite to eat." I sat down knowing exactly what I wanted.

After being seated, 20 minutes later a waitress had taken my order. Just a small pizza pie.

10 minutes go by.

Then 30.

Then 45.

Finally at 60, my waitress offers to give my a "salad" on the house because my pizza was taking to long. It was blander than a pop-country song and had a hint of vomit. I couldn't finish it.

After waiting another 15 minutes, I decided I had better places to be, and left before I ever got my pizza after an hour and 15 minutes of waiting. Good thing, too, because I wasn't about to pay $11 for a personal pizza that tasted like compacted garbage.
author: Kelly S.

description:
This is a GREAT spot. I didn't try the food but my beer was actually cold. Not room temperature but cold. The staff was nice and crowd was extremely friendly. I would go back again and try the food. 

Yes, the Red Stripe is $2 and the other pints are $4, still a good price. You can smoke on the patio and it's heated.
author: E P.

description:
Came here for dinner after work on a weekday. Quiet, low-key. Ordered a pizza. It was not bad; what you'd expect from this kind of place.

It was refreshing to get a real meat-mountain gooey-cheese pizza instead of some California chicken pesto spinach seafood white sauce pizza.
author: Rob T.

description:
Il Pirata is O.G. It's been there for years now. I remember going there for a couple events and fundraisers for community organizations so that's a plus! Any establishment that accomodates community is a positive in my book.

I haven't been there in years (as I've mentioned above) but last Friday, I went there for the Flipped Out Comedy event put on by Speech Therapy (Kiko & Tony Sparks) and it was overflowing. The event started at 9:00p but folks came through around 8:30p and ordered food. The staff and owners are really friendly. The drinks were affordable and most importantly the vibe of the crowd was nice and easy. My favorite part of Il Pirata are the outdoor patios. There's one in the back and one right by the front entrance. Since the venue was packed it was nice to have patios for the crowd to pour out into especially since it got stuffy. It's good to know that this place still exists and continues to provide a cool spot to chill out.
author: Ivan F.

description:
Great little local bar within walking distance from my place in Portrero Hill. I was craving a good local dive/sports bar in the neighborhood since the Connecticut Yankee was a disappointment the last time I was there and it was refreshing to see that in Il Pirata. 

We were served at the bar and then went to the patio on a beautiful 80 degree afternoon. Waitress was attentive and sociable and we enjoyed our time there. Was there only for drinks and didnt try the pizza, but wsa tempted. Will be back soon to try it out.......The pizza by the slice didnt look to appealing, it was a slow weekday afternoon and wasnt much of a crowd so it looked like it had been out for a while (although probably just needed re-heating).
author: Tom D.

description:
Arrrrr....

A pirate themed bar should be a lot less depressing than this.
author: Andrew L.

description:
If you're in the mood for a dive bar that isn't a complete dive, il pirata is the place.  They have everything from black label scotch to a yieger machine.  It's the type of place you go with a few guys to throw a few back while watching the games on the HDTV.  

We made this our home after getting our butts kicked in our softball league games.  The bartender would make fun of us for losing every week and guy us beers to mollify our bruised egos.  What more do you want from your neighborhood bartender?

WARNING: if you get too friendly with the bartender & owner, they will actually try and get you wasted.
author: peter k.

description: This place is good for pre-gaming and when you need space because you're bringing the party. Prices pretty cheap and if they happen to have a good DJ I could see it being alright. Great place to pre-game slash meetup before walking up Utah to Mighty: http://www.yelp.com/biz/mighty-san-francisco
author: Joey M.

description: Not one, but TWO outdoor patios! (The one on the right has heat lamps.) The patio comes in handy for pie-ing your friend in the face if you need to. Friendly bartenders too.
author: Wendy C.

description: Delicious food here.  My co-workers and I have eaten lunch here a few times and they do not disappoint.  The staff are all nice and polite.
author: Jae V.

description: If you're in the market for a chill space to throw a party you might consider Il Pirata.This place has all the amenities. A sound system with CD and Vinyl decks, good food and a dope little patio setup. The location doesn't invite much in the way of foot traffic but what can you do. Bill, the owner was super easy to deal with. My only issue is that they won't let me spin Hip- Hop here. As it was explained to me it was nothing personal, just an SFPD thing. If I lived closer I would be putting the dual patio's to use this summer. If you happen to be in the area it would definitely be worth checking out especially if the weathers nice.
author: Mingus R.

description:
Il Pirata is my new favorite "Dive Bar with Beer Garden." I think it is also the top contender for my 30th birthday party location. I found it by tagging along on a pub crawl where every location had a beer garden (best theme ever) and we ended the night at Il Pirata. They have a variety of spaces but the main draw is the awesome beer garden which is a great size and surrounded by trees. It feels like noise is not an issue because the area is mostly industrial. There is a huge BBQ which we got to use with the understanding that all alcohol would be purchased at the bar. It was a Saturday night and unexpectedly empty (seems like they would be more popular for the after-work crowd because of the location) and we had almost full run of the place. The bartender was friendly and the prices were good.
Overall I would describe Il Pirata as a low-key, comfortable, spacious, cleaner version of the Zeitgeist.
author: Cyrelle D.

description: Divey but I absolutely love how meticulously they approach their beer glassware. Chilled pilner glasses stored cleanly in the fridge, perfect Guinness pours...
author: Lyly D.

description: Il Pirata's the shit! Whenever I come down to the city, I'm usually going to start my day off here and begin my taxi powered trek through the city. My buddy dj's on Sundays here for Reggae Church. It's always a great crowd on Sundays and everyone's mad friendly. 2 dollar red stripes and if it's sunny out, Chef's gonna be fucking your palette up with that Ital Fire! The drinks will creep on you and there's always some good food around. The balconie's are real nice to drink on because drinking inside a dark bar just makes me feel like an old alchie. They always got something interesting going on at this spot, so go comadere yourself a table and shoot the shit with some real pirates. YAAAAARRRGGGHHHHHHH gimmmmee that booty!!!!
author: Andrew K.

description: For the food I can only say 2 stars. This is the place to go if you want to be in a party with other 49er fans. Fun and loud; go here with a bunch o friends and watch the game.
author: Chris O.

description: I was thrown a wedding shower here this weekend. What a nice little neighborhood spot. Not fancy, kind of divey, and a big mermaid mural on the wall. The owner, Bill, and the kitchen and wait staff are wonderful. If I ever ventured to Potrero for anything other than Thee Parkside or Bottom of the Hill, I'd probably spend a lot of time at il Pirata.
author: Kirsten B.

description: I really enjoy this place.  A lot of local regulars who are great people. Good beer, nice wait and bar staff. My favorite food is the Steak Bruchetta.....makes my mouth water just thinking of it. 4 thick slices of steak on slices of french roll with garlicy bruchetta and a pesto sauce on top. And all of that for like 8 or 9 bucks. Totally wonderful and well worth it!
author: Cheery O.

description: I came back yesterday for lunch.  We had pizza with custom toppings... It was the bomb.... The pizza was soo good.  We couldn't finish so I packed it home and still good the next day.... I would definitely go back there for pizza anytime :)
author: Lily K.

description: I have a receipt for this place in my wallet and, for the life of me, cannot remember coming here.  Thank goodness for Yelp, which dutifully lists addresses.  It is up the street, to the right from Mighty.  Oh yes, I come here for my usual--a beer or cider--before I head over to Mighty.  The bartenders are friendly and there are plasma screen televisions tuned to CNN so that you can keep abreast on the news.  Nice, as that is my ideal prerequisite before I hop on the stage at Mighty.
author: Dee C.

description: This place kicks ass! I've been coming here almost every sunday for the past year. Sunday's are the reggae day spot called "CHURCH". $2 red stripes and very generously poured drinks. They have a caribbean bbq on one of the two patios with kick ass jerk. Bill who owns the place and his girlfriend janet man the bar and you couldn't know two nicer people. In response to everyone who says they try to get you drunk, of course they do, it's a bar, what are you bitching about. This place is one of those bars with a local feel, thank god it hasn't been overrun by hipsters, b&t's and marina jerks.
author: mike m.

description: Great on Wednesday nights for no cover Psy Trance.  Good times.
author: matthew w.

description: Had a great time listening to live jazz at Il Pirata on Thursday.  The place is old San Francisco style - we ordered bruscetta and buffalo wings, which were great.  The waitress was very nice and the whole place feels friendly and low key.   The music was a real plus!
author: S O.

description: Visited Il Pirata on Sunday, December 27th.  Was looking for a dog friendly brunch and couldn't have found a better place.  Starting with the fabulous Natalie  - who kept the mimosas flowing -  to the great food to the great patio, the meal was perfect.  Make sure to order the bruschetta appetizer - fresh and garlicy and super scrumptious.
author: Preston P.

description:
the pirate rocks.  friendly bartenders, friendly patrons, and tons of variance in subject matter.  they have a great reggae night on sunday and eclectic electronic followed by psy-trance (!) on wednesday.  reasonably priced, big tvs in the main bar for sports-watching, and generally a good vibe.  

i had a run-in with a surly bouncer one night, but that was more or less offset by a good experience with another (dave) on another night.  highly recommended.
author: Brad S.

description: The place has a nice vibe but the big negative is that they try to rip you off if you leave a credit card at the bar. My wife was charged for 6 drinks when she only had 3 and even though Il Pirata's own billing system showed only 5. When she went back the next day they refunded her for 1 drink but refused to accept that they overcharged for 2 more drinks. I was also overcharged for 2 drinks the same day. Bottomline: if you are running a tab at the bar, keep a close watch on the total number of drinks they charge you for.
author: Makina L.

description: This place is a great dive with great food!  Don't expect great service or a fancy atmosphere but they have big old booths and some of the best tasting and best priced italian food in the area.  Might I recommend starting off your dinner with an order of  Bruchetta, probaly the best I have ever had.  And all the dinners come with a giant salad.  A bottle of wine will only run you about $16.  If you are there on a night that it turns into a club they just will set up around you.  Nice Bar Too!
author: Enzo S.

description:
generally i like il pirata. nice outdoor patio, crazy cheep redstripe on sundays.

but, we read about this brunch special they have on sunday's - hookah and alice in wonderland brunch.

so we got some of our favorite peeps together for it. it advertised as noon to 4pm. so we got there at noon.

the organizer of the brunch didn't get there till 1:30, the special brunch food they served was small and not that tasty, the hookah tobacco was cheap and poorly flavored.

decided to order eggs benedict from the regular brunch menu instead... it was made on regular white toast, with bacon and really bad hollandaise sauce.  to make it worse, i think it gave us mild food reaction and have been slightly sick for the past 24 hours

so, all in all, skip the sunday hookah/alice in wonderland brunch.  decent advertising, bad delivery and poor quality.

i will say that their pizza looked awesome.  i think next time just pizza and redstrip - just that would earn them a 4 star! : )
author: nathan p.

description:
You let me take my drink TO GO!!! When that happened I automattically saw the lil yelp star rating go from ?? to 4.  I was like, WTF, OH HELL YEAH! 

All up in the plastic cup it went as I staggered out the door and headed down the street to Mighty with a full mixture for cheap. Shoot, I'll save my $$ and get fawked up at IL Pirata then walk to Mighty! PLAN and it succeeded.

This place is also cool to catch some local shows, some DJ's, and the bartenders are cool as hell. Really, what else can you ask for? I've played a handful of shows here and between the strong drinks, outside smoking area, and being a few blocks from another club.... man oh man.. gooood times.
author: Jay D.

description: this is the spot on a friday night.  great people, good food, and good DJ's
author: patty r.

description:
i was here saturday night, and i accidentally peed in the women's bathroom.

three stars!
author: Steve T.

description: ARRR, where the hell are the pirates, matey!?
author: Jill k.

description: I don't know anything about this place except that we showed up at the last minute to see the France-Brasil match (Cafe' Couleur was way too packed). Well, they turned on for us a huge HDTV, they tuned it on ESPN-HD, they turned off some lights to increase the signal-noise ratio of the room and have been hyper-friendly. We probably could have asked also for the remote control... By the way, food: I had a bruschetta caprese and it was pretty good except the excessive amount of garlic. I promise I'll post an update.
author: Dario B.

description: Pizza here was excellent, really liked the atmosphere of the place, and the waitress was not only one of the most beautiful women I've seen in a long, long time-a very beautiful latina-but also extremely nice and offered refills-a-plenty when I wasnt even that low, where as virtually every restaurant I go to I need to wait 5 minutes till AFTER I'm empty before I can finally catch the waitress' eye.  Yeah maybe there's an extra star because I'm totally in love with her, but atleast 4 of them are on the establishment itself.  Like I said-great pizza, great service, and the place was clean, nice and comfortable.
author: Sean V.

description: Great fun. Great martinis. Great owners.
author: MARGARITA V.

description: I love this place. I have been drinking here almost every Friday for the past year! Billy the owner, is a cool dude. Buy him a shot of Lager if you go. Theres 2 outdoor patios with heat lamps. Food! The calamari, buffalo wings and garlic fries is very good!
author: Dao C.

description: Il Pirata seems to have great potential, with the huge space, lots of outdoor seating, and the cool sign. Yet, there is something not that appealing about it. I've just been there twice, for music/dance events despite living nearby for years.
author: Amy E.

description: GOOOOOD TIMES!!! Every Wednesday night is amazing. Great staff, good crowd, all in out a killer spot!!
author: Nicolo P.

description: I've been driving past this place for the last 6 months and finally made it last weekend. Have to admit, I made my decision based on Yelp reviews and was a bit apprehensive at first. It looked like it would either be amazing or absolutely awful. Everything turned out great. I went with a group of 8 people - we drank a lot of wine for really cheap and had some good pizza. Not the best pizza in SF, but definitely a respectable showing. The bruschetta was also tasty as was the pasta. Most importantly, we got drunk and full on the cheap. Extra points for a worthy music selection on the juke box and good beer options. Also has a relatively low hipster factor, which is impressive given its location. Can't wait for summer to come along so I can hang on the patios and check out the live music.
author: Dan M.

description: Food here is good and cheap. However, be prepared to WAIT!  We went there for lunch, and waited a 1/2hour with no bread and waited for an extra 15minutes to even get our drinks.  We were just about to walk out, when our food was packaged (had to request it to go). The bar tender is a real B....! Has an attitude a mile high!  What do you expect from a dive bar?!
author: Catherine H.

description: I would have to agree with Eddie H's post from 2007.  The salsa night here is awesome!  The salsa party is thrown on the last Friday of every month and has a pretty strong following, I guess because the music and atmosphere is so addicting.  There is a gorgeous young lady that serves Cuban and other West Indian fare on the patio after 10pm on that last Friday.  I highly recommend her empanadas but don't stop there; her "platos" are slamming as well.  Regulars know to head to the patio 1st and buy their food up front as she is usually sold out by midnight.  If you get the itch for another salsa party of the same caliber but can't wait until the ultimate Friday, the same dj's spin at Little Baobob on 19th (info is on their website www.anejoprod.com.)    La Tropi-Cal at Il Pirata is definitely worth checking out, even if it is only to snack on some Cuban goodness and watch some fantastic dancing.
author: Cynthia B.

description: so i went there on a Sunday. it was pretty chill. they serve red stripes by the bucket..so thats always a plus. it was just ten bucks for five of em. so thumbs up on that. its green friendly..(just beware of random strangers wanting to get into the rotation without contributing). has some outdoor seating..and a dance floor..all in all. its a chill place to talk, drink some beer and smoke some herb
author: Sandi V.

description: I really like this place.  We used to come here often when they would have Silent, with drum & bass DJs.  The bartenders are really cool.  There's one bartender (not sure if he's still there), if you teach him how to make a drink, he'll give it to you for free.  The patio was cool, there are a few tables out there to get fresh air at.  I never been there for the food, but I heard it was pretty good.
author: Charlene R.

description: Many years ago - probably before most of you were even born, my family used to eat at Il Pirata.  They served the most amazing Minestrone soup - family style - just thinking about it makes my mouth water.  Last time I ate there was at least 20 years ago - so a few weeks ago when a friend and I were looking for local restaurants to hold our high school reunion I suggested Il Pirata.  I was really shocked at how run down the place looked but figured if the food was still good - who cares how it looks.  But the food, it wasn't so good.  My salad was ok but my entree - chicken parm - was underseasoned and tough.  My friend's  entree - eggplant parm - was a big ball of gooey cheese.   So the food sucked compared to 30 years ago - but the strangest part of the evening was the cook & waiter who seemed to have a unique love/hate relationship.  The cook kept glaring at her, making hand gestures and faces and she kept apologizing for messing up - yet her service was fine.  All in all, a very strange dining experience for this geezer :)
author: theresa k.

description: Love this place expecially on Sunday! Sally bartends.. that girl makes a mean cup of coffee, has great conversation, and makes me laugh my ass off!
author: Nadia T.

description: the first  thing i have to say is there buffalo wings  are finger licking good.  you can eat  and have a drink while watching  sports on there big screen not just one screen but 4.  and  if you want to sit outside and get some fresh air  and have a smoke there outside   patio has heated lamps. when i step in il pirata if feel very welcome by the locals and the bartenders there great people to be around.
author: SEN M.
